lessonDescription: In this exercise we'll practice joining more tables together, leading up to one really big query.

lessonScreens.screenMd:
Let's practice joining tables together, but this time working with customer and pizza order information. 

Start by pulling up the ```customer``` table.

```
SELECT 
	c.customer_id,
	c.first_name,
	c.city
FROM 
	customer AS c
```

SELECT

	c.first_name,
	c.city,
	po.order_id,
	po.order_date,
	po.total_amount,
	pol.line_number,
	p.pizza_name,
	sc.size_name,
	pol.quantity,
	pol.pizza_price
FROM 
	customer AS c
	JOIN pizza_order AS po ON c.customer_id = po.customer_id
	JOIN pizza_order_line AS pol ON po.order_id = pol.order_id
	JOIN pizza AS p ON pol.pizza_id = p.pizza_id
	JOIN size_code AS sc ON pol.size_code = sc.size_code

lessonScreens.screenMd:
Oofta! That's quite a query. And look at all those columns!

To help give these results some order, lets sort the results by customer first name, order id, and line number. 

Remember how to do that? (use the hint button if you forgot)
lessonScreens.screenText:
Oofta! That's quite a query. And look at all those columns!

To help give these results some order, lets sort the results by customer first name, order id, and line number.

Remember how to do that? (use the hint button if you forgot)
lessonScreens.sqlTarget:
SELECT 
	c.customer_id,
	c.first_name,
	c.city,
	po.order_id,
	po.order_date,
	po.total_amount,
	pol.line_number,
	p.pizza_name,
	sc.size_name,
	pol.quantity,
	pol.pizza_price
FROM 
	customer AS c
	JOIN pizza_order AS po ON c.customer_id = po.customer_id
	JOIN pizza_order_line AS pol ON po.order_id = pol.order_id
	JOIN pizza AS p ON pol.pizza_id = p.pizza_id
	JOIN size_code AS sc ON pol.size_code = sc.size_code
ORDER BY 
	c.first_name,
	po.order_id,
	pol.line_number

lessonScreens.screenMd:
Excellent! That's a nice looking query. It's so comprehensive!

There really isn't a limit to how many tables you can join in one query (in a practical sense), but you may find out that too many joins start to slow down your queries. 

Keep this in mind as you write large queries against other real-world databases.
